block.p: Karen Rebecca Tolchin, the daughter of Susan and Martin Tolchin of Washington, was married there last evening at the Cosmos Club to Lt. j.g. Todd David Vance, the son of Helen and David Vance of Springfield, Va. Rabbi Howard Berman officiated with the Rev. George Vance, a United Methodist minister and a grandfather of the bridegroom.

Dr. Vance, 30, graduated from Bryn Mawr College and received a doctorate in English and American literature in May from Brandeis University. Her father, a former Washington correspondent for The New York Times, is the publisher and editor in chief of The Hill, a weekly newspaper that reports on Congress. Her mother is a professor of public policy at George Mason University in Fairfax, Va. The bridegroom's parents also are co-authors of ''Selling Our Security: The Erosion of America's Assets'' (Alfred A. Knopf, 1992).

Lieutenant Vance, 25, graduated from the United States Coast Guard Academy and is the executive officer on the Coast Guard cutter Farallon. His father is the director of retirement and insurance for the Airline Pilots Association in Reston, Va. The bridegroom's mother teaches eighth-grade English at the Washington Irving Middle School in Springfield.
